javaslang.algebra

Interface BiFunctor<T1,T2>

  • Type Parameters:
    T1 - component type of the 1st Functor
    T2 - component type of the 2nd Functor
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Either<L,R>, Map<K,V>, SortedMap<K,V>, Validation<E,T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Either.Left, Either.LeftProjection, Either.Right, Either.RightProjection, HashMap, LinkedHashMap, TreeMap, Validation.Invalid, Validation.Valid

    public interface BiFunctor<T1,T2>
    A BiFunctor combines two unrelated Functors.
    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Daniel Dietrich

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <U1,U2> BiFunctor<U1,U2> bimap(Function<? super T1,? extends U1> f1, Function<? super T2,? extends U2> f2)
      Applies two functions f1, f2 to the components of this BiFunctor.

    • Method Detail

      • bimap

        <U1,U2> BiFunctor<U1,U2> bimap(Function<? super T1,? extends U1> f1,
                               Function<? super T2,? extends U2> f2)
        Applies two functions f1, f2 to the components of this BiFunctor.
        Type Parameters:
        U1 - 1st component type of the resulting BiFunctor
        U2 - 2nd component type of the resulting BiFunctor
        Parameters:
        f1 - mapper of 1st component
        f2 - mapper of 2nd component
        Returns:
        a new BiFunctor
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if f1 or f2 is null
